contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=September 2010}} '''Zu Gengzhi''' ({{zh|t=祖暅之|s=祖暅之|p=Zǔ Gèngzhī|w=Tsu Kengchi}}, born ca. 450, died ca. 520)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/1073908/Zu-Gengzhi| title=Zu Gengzhi|publisher=''[[Encyclopædia Britannica]]''|date=|accessdate=2008-10-13}}</ref> was a [[Chinese people|Chinese]] [[mathematician]]. His [[Chinese style name|courtesy name]] was '''Jing Shuo''' (景烁) and he was sometimes referred to as '''Zu Geng'''. He was the son of another famous Chinese mathematician, [[Zu Chongzhi]]. ==See also== *[[List of Chinese mathematicians]] *[[Shen Kuo]] *[[Wei Pu]] ==References== {{ChineseText}} {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www-history.mcs.st-and.ac.uk/history/Mathematicians/Zu_Geng.html Zu Geng at MacTutor] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Zu Gengzhi | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Chinese mathematician | DATE OF BIRTH = ca. 450 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = ca. 520 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zu Gengzhi}} [[Category:480 births]] [[Category:525 deaths]] [[Category:Ancient Chinese mathematicians]] [[Category:5th-century mathematicians]] [[Category:6th-century mathematicians]] [[Category:Southern Qi politicians]] [[Category:Liang Dynasty politicians]] {{China-scientist-stub}} {{Asia-mathematician-stub}}
